Song.title: Angels We Have Heard On High (Tomlin)
Song.copyright: Chris Tomlin/Â© 2009 worshiptogether.com songs (Admin. by EMI Christian Music Publishing)

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [E A2 C#m7 A2] VERSE 1: [E]Angels we have heard on high, [E]Sweetly singing o'er the plains [E]And the mountains in reply, [E]Echoing their joy-ous strains
CHORUS: [E]Glo[C#m]-[F#m7]-[B]-[E]-[A2]-[B]-ria [E]In ex-cel-sis De-o[B] [E]Glo[C#M]-[F#m7]-[B]-[E]-[A2]-[B]-ria [E]In [B]ex-[E]cel-[A]sis [E]De[B]-[E]o
[E A2 C#m A2] VERSE 2: [E]Shepherds why this jub-i-lee? [E]Why your joyous strains prolong? [E]What the glad-some ti-dings be, [E]Which in-spire your heav'nly song?
Chorus:
[E Esus E Esus E]
VERSE 3: [E]Come to Bethlehem and see, [E]Him whose birth the an-gels sing [E]Come adore on ben-ded knee, [E]Christ the Lord, the new-born King
Chorus:
Ending: [E A2 C#m7 A2 E A2 C#m7 A2]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 angels we have heard on high sweetly singing oer the plains and the mountains in reply echoing their joyous strains chorus gloria in excelsis deo gloria in excelsis deo verse 2 shepherds why this jubilee why your joyous strains prolong what the gladsome tidings be which inspire your heavnly song chorus verse 3 come to bethlehem and see him whose birth the angels sing come adore on bended knee christ the lord the newborn king chorus ending

VERSE 2: [E]Shepherds why this [Bsus]ju[B]b-i-[E]lee? Why [B]your [E]joyous [E/B]strains[B7] pro[E]long? [E]What the glad-some [Bsus]ti[B]-dings [E]be, Which [B]in-[E]spire your [E/B]heav[B7]'nly [E]song?
